III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12207
Section • (3) An agency shall require that social service workers be
Description directly responsible for all the following activities:
• (b) Facilitating services and parenting time for
children for purposes of reunification.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Prior to a youth's removal from their parental placement, a doctor
had recommended that they have an MRI with a neuro
assessment to determine if behavioral issues were a result of
neurological care. Foster care has been made aware of this
recommendation and has yet to comply since removal in 2022.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Relative A was interviewed by phone on 3/24/2025. She reported
Youth A was living with her and was demonstrating a lot of
behavioral problems. She reported brining him to the local
children’s hospital where Youth A was evaluated by a doctor, she
thinks may have been a psychologist, but she was not sure.
Relative A stated the doctor recommended Youth A receive an
MRI and a neurological exam to see if there were neurological
concerns causing his behavioral issues. Relative A stated she
made two phone calls to schedule the evaluations, but there were
no answers. The third call was answered, but Relative A was told
they were no longer making any appointments as they had too
many people waiting to get the tests performed. Relative A stated
Youth A was removed from her home on 12/22/2022 and has
since been in seven placements. She reported she has told his
case managers and other professionals involved about the MRI
and neurological assessment recommendations, but she keeps
being told his placements will take care of his assessments. She
stated she mentioned the tests to Youth A’s current foster care
worker three weeks ago.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed via virtual conferencing
on 3/24/2025. He reported Youth A was initially removed from
Relative A’s home due to him assaulting Relative A. At that time,
Youth A was a juvenile justice ward only. Youth A entered foster
care in June of 2024. Since that time, he has had three different
foster care workers assigned due to staffing changes. Foster Care
Supervisor stated Relative A had not told them about a
recommendation of an MRI or neurological exam. He stated Youth
A’s foster care workers have expressed Relative A demonstrates
a memory deficit. Foster Care Supervisor stated Youth A will be
transitioning to an out of state placement and he will make sure
that placement knows of the recommendations Relative A is
requesting.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via virtual conferencing on
3/25/2025. She reported being Youth A’s worker since October of
2024. She stated Youth A was in a delinquency placement prior to
2

a petition for placement in foster care being filed in June of 2024.
She reported the case was adjudicated in February of 2025. She
stated, during a meeting last week, Relative A told her about the
MRI and neurological assessment recommendations she received
in 2022. Foster Care Worker stated Youth A has been evaluated
by multiple physicians and mental health providers and no one
has recommended an MRI or a neurological exam. Foster Care
Worker stated she told Relative A about the lack of current
recommendations for these exams during their meeting last week.
She stated Youth A is moving to an out of sate placement and she
will let someone at that facility know of Relative A’s concerns.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
Psychiatric Updates and Medication Reviews dated 7/16/2024,
8/5/2024, 9/30/2024, 10/8/2024, 10/10/2024, 10/24/2024, and
2/6/2025, none of which contained a recommendation for an MRI
or neurological examination.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as at least 7 psychiatric
examinations and medication reviews have been completed since
Youth A’s entry into foster care, none of which recommended an
MRI or neurological examinations.
Despite the lack of the recommendations for the examinations
requested by Relative A, the foster care supervisor will inform staff
at Youth A’s placement of the recommendation the relative
received 3 years ago so they can determine if those
recommendations are still appropriate.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
